translated: Birth Stories🔽The Group of Sixes🔽The Chapter on Bad Sons
The Birth Story of the Crow (Jātaka 1.409)
“You eat fine food,
sesame oil and ghee, uncle;
But for what reason,
are you so thin, crow?”
“Living among enemies,🔽among them, because of material things,
always with a troubled heart,
how can the crow be strong?
The crows are always troubled,
cursing because of bad deeds;
Even when they get food, it doesn’t satisfy,

analyzed: kiso tenasmi vaṭṭaka  lūkhāni tiṇa bījāni
translated: and so I’m thin, crow.🔽You eat coarse grass seeds,
with little oil;
But for what reason,
are you so fat, crow?”
“Because of fewness of wishes and few concerns,
and because of not going far,
making do with what I get,

original: thūlo tenasmi vāyasa.🔽Appicchassa hi posassa,🔽appacintasukhassa ca;
analyzed: vāyasa  appicchassa hi posassa  appa cinta sukhassa ca
translated: and so I’m fat, crow.🔽For one with few wishes,🔽who is happy with few concerns,
who has a well-controlled mind,
one’s livelihood is well-obtained.”🔽The Birth Story of the Crow (Jātaka 1.409)
